description: Borrowed from French capricieux, from Italian capriccioso, from capriccio.

adjectives.description: capricious (comparative more capricious, superlative most capricious)

entries.meaning: Impulsive and unpredictable; determined by chance, impulse, or whim.
examples: I almost died in a capricious winter storm.
Stringent rulers are unlikely to act capriciously.
